desmoj.extensions.experimentation.ui

Class TimeSeriesPlotter

  • java.lang.Object
    • desmoj.extensions.experimentation.ui.GraphicalObserver
      • desmoj.extensions.experimentation.ui.TimeSeriesPlotter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ExperimentListener, SimRunListener, ChartOwner, IGraphicalObserver, java.util.EventListener, java.util.Observer

    public class TimeSeriesPlotter
extends GraphicalObserver
implements ExperimentListener, ChartOwner, java.util.Observer
    A simple time series plotter that can be displayed in the experiment launcher.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  TimeSeriesPlotter.SimpleTimeSeriesViewer
      A simple means of drawing a TimeSeries without requiring the experimentation GUI by adding a TimeSeriesPlotter to an otherwise empty Frame.

        title - window title
        context - the context to show this observer in
        data - TimeSeries to display
        winWidth - width of window
        winHeight - height of window
        String - legend (only used if further plots are added to this plotter)

      • drawChart

        public void drawChart(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Draws the values given by the TimeSeries statistic object into the chart. This method is automatically invoked by the chart object, if it has to repaint.
        Specified by:
        drawChart in interface ChartOwner
        Parameters:
        g - The specified Graphics object.

      • update

        public void update(java.util.Observable x,
                   java.lang.Object y)
        The update method (required by interface 'Observer') will be called, if the TimeSeries produces new values.
        Specified by:
        update in interface java.util.Observer

      • updatePlotter

        public void updatePlotter()
        This method updates the chart. The chart will only be repainted if a new scaling is required. If no rescaling is required, then only the new values are painted. Of course this is much faster. Because the TimeSeriesPlotter has no bench marks for scaling at the beginning, you have to call this method at least one time, when the upper and lower limits are known.
